project.name: Permutations, Combinations - Student Version
project.notes: This game covers topics of discrete mathematics for high schools students. Here, Students will learn about permutations, combinations, and probability associated with permutations and combinations. Students will learn about the differences between permutations and combinations. They will also learn about the formulas used to calculate permutations and combinations as well as the ideas they are based on, so they will understand why they work. Students will assess their understanding using an interactive Snap! program, where they will attempt practice problems and modify the code to implement the formulas. Certain blanks will have to be filled in by the student for a smooth play as well!

scene.name: Permutations, Combinations - Student Version
scene.notes: This game covers topics of discrete mathematics for high schools students. Here, Students will learn about permutations, combinations, and probability associated with permutations and combinations. Students will learn about the differences between permutations and combinations. They will also learn about the formulas used to calculate permutations and combinations as well as the ideas they are based on, so they will understand why they work. Students will assess their understanding using an interactive Snap! program, where they will attempt practice problems and modify the code to implement the formulas. Certain blanks will have to be filled in by the student for a smooth play as well!

block.l: These two are the same combination

list.l: Would choosing three desserts from a menu be a combination or a permutation?
Choosing three desserts from a menu would be a combination because the order of the desserts does not matter.
Would ranking your three favorite movies be a combination or a permutation?
When ranking movies, order matters, so it would be a permutation. For example, 1. Iron Man, 2. Avengers 3. Thor is different than 1, Avengers 2. Thor 3. Iron Man.
Would a lock consisting of 4 digits be a permutation or combination?
Order matters in a lock, so it would be a permutation. For example, 1234 is not the same as 4321 when you are dealing with locks.
Would the numbers on a lottery ticket be a combination or permutation?
On a lottery ticket, the numbers need to match the number drawn by the lottery. The order of the numbers does not matter, therefore it would be a combination.
Susan is creating a quiz with 6 questions. How many possible ways of arranging these questions are there?
Nick is randomly arranging the numbers 1, 2, and 3. What is the probability that the arrangement turns out to be 312? Enter your answer as a decimal rounded to the nearest hundredth.
How many possible lock codes are there if a lock contains 4 digits (from 0 to 9).
Richard is packing shirts for an upcoming vacation. He has 7 unique shirts and wants to pack 4. How many possible combinations are there?
Anna is randomly selecting 2 movies to watch out of Sing, Encanto, and the Incredibles. What is the probability that she watches Encanto and Sing?
